title: Vada Pav
description: Spicy potato fritter placed inside a bun, served with chutneys and fried green chili, popular street food of Mumbai.

title: Khichdi
description: Comforting dish made of rice and lentils cooked with mild spices, served with ghee and pickle.

title: Masala Dosa
description: Crispy fermented rice crepe filled with spicy mashed potatoes, served with coconut chutney and hot sambar.

title: Aloo Paratha
description: Stuffed flatbread made with spiced mashed potatoes, cooked on a griddle and served with butter or curd.

title: Pakhala Bhata
description: Fermented rice soaked in water, served with fried vegetables and pickles, a cooling summer dish from Odisha.

title: Poha
description: Flattened rice cooked with turmeric, onions, peanuts, and curry leaves, a light and flavorful breakfast option.

title: Dhokla
description: Soft and spongy steamed cake made from fermented chickpea flour, tempered with mustard seeds and chilies.

title: Pani Puri
description: Crispy hollow puris filled with tangy flavored water, mashed potatoes, and chickpeas, a popular street snack.

title: Idli Sambar
description: Steamed rice cakes served with hot and tangy sambar and coconut chutney, a popular South Indian breakfast.

title: Dal Baati Churma
description: Traditional dish with baked wheat baatis served with spicy lentil curry and sweet churma on the side.

title: Samosa
description: Deep-fried triangular pastry stuffed with spicy potatoes, peas, and herbs, served with tangy chutneys.

title: Rasgulla
description: Soft, spongy balls made from chhena and soaked in sugar syrup, a famous Bengali dessert loved across India.
